abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Ukraine - Hydropower
            Rehabilitation and System Control Project was satisfactory,
            the sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was modest, and the Bank and borrower performance
            were both satisfactory. The lessons learned indicated that
            it is important to have a reform-oriented government not
            only during the project preparation, but throughout the
            entire project cycle as well. The experience in Ukraine has
            shown that a reversal of the initially progressive course of
            economic reforms have adversely affected the implementation
            of the Bank's investment project. During the project
            preparation the government indicated that improving
            financial discipline in the energy sector, was a priority of
            its reform program, and the project generated specific
            pressure on the government to deliver in this regard. Cash
            collections reached their highest levels only when included
            as specific targets in the International Monetary
            Fund's Extended Fund Facility Program, and the
            Bank's Programmatic Adjustment Loan. The donors'
            working group on energy sector reforms has provided valuable
            assistance to the government's sector reform efforts.
